headline: Dolan 'not looking backwards' in Ohio GOP Senate primary dominated by Trump, amid bump in polls down stretch
author: Tyler Olson
sentences:
FOX NEWS POLL: VANCE MOVES INTO TOP SPOT IN OHIO GOP SENATE PRIMARY
Dolan separated himself from the four other top candidates competing in the GOP primary by not aggressively courting former President Donald Trump's endorsement.

Republican Ohio Senate candidate Matt Dolan didn't attract as much media attention as other candidates for most of the GOP primary  but he thinks he'll pull off a win due to his focus on Ohio voters over national politicians.

WITH CRUZ BACKING, MANDEL BRUSHES OFF RINO ATTACKS AFTER BOOK ALLEGES DISHONESTY
In an interview at the Delaware County Republican Party Lincoln Reagan Dinner, the state senator made clear that he supports Trump's policies.

Lacking flashy endorsements from national Republicans like some of the other candidates in the GOP primary  while also largely avoiding mudslinging and attacks  Dolan's hasn't been a mainstay of national news coverage.
"And I have felt it for some time because Ohio Republicans want somebody who's talking about their financial security, their neighborhood security, their border security, international security."
But that endorsement was seen as a major blow to fellow candidates Mike Gibbons, Josh Mandel and Jane Timken, all of whom pressed hard to demonstrate their loyalty to the former president.
That doesn't seem to bother Dolan, who was the only candidate besides Vance to gain ground in the Fox News Poll since the last iteration, before the Trump endorsement.
Dolan says he thinks his message may be enough to win Tuesday's primary and to beat likely Democratic nominee Rep. Tim Ryan, R-Ohio, in the general election.
And he's used a $2 million TV ad buy down the stretch of the campaign to tell voters to "forget all their nonsense," referring to the other candidates.
"I don't know what they can offer to Republicans that want someone to be positive for what Republicans stand for and execute on that.
